result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elmo Jerome Peyton III

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Elmo Jerome Peyton III.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial.  Defendant has a new case pending, 22CM2615, the State is moving to join and requesting an adjournment.  Court finds good cause that the adjournment will not violate the defendant's speedy trial demand.  Case is adjourned to 11-7-22 at 8:30 am for status conference, by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Elmo Jerome Peyton III.  Attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a speedy demand jury trial.  Attorney Richardson is in a speedy trial demand jury trial in another court and unable to proceed today and defense is requesting time to investigate a possible alibi.   Court finds speedy trial demand is not implicated. Case is adjourned to 10-24-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton III not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III appeared by video for Elmo Jerome Peyton III.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 9-6-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Jury trial is scheduled for 9-6-22 at 8:30 am.  Defense is requesting an adjourned final pretrial.  Case is adjourned to 9-1-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State will be filing new charges.  Defendant enters speedy trial demand.  Case is adjourned to 8-17-22 at 8:30 am and 9-6-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10
Defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton in court with attorney Fred Richardson, appear by video.  Defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer A. Domagalaski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Shquita M., Victoria J., Katara M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.     If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  Monittoring is with 24 hour curfew.
  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, no electronic monitoring.\
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
